abstract: SolarCity’s plans to install solar panels for more than 100,000 military housing units has been revived with private financing after it failed to receive a loan guarantee from the federal government.
snippet: SolarCity’s plans to install solar panels for more than 100,000 military housing units has been revived with private financing after it failed to receive a loan guarantee from the federal government.
lead_paragraph: An ambitious project by a California company to install solar panels for more than 100,000 military housing units has been revived with private financing after it failed to receive a loan guarantee from the federal government.

headline.main: Private Dollars Revive a Solar Panel Plan for Military Housing
headline.print_headline: Private Dollars Revive a Solar Panel Plan for Military Housing

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
